{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the provided documents, preterm labor is defined as uterine contractions that occur between 20 and 37 weeks' gestation with progressive cervical dilatation or effacement or both. The goal of treatment is to decrease uterine contractility to prevent premature delivery. Methyl alcohol is not a medication used to treat preterm labor, as it is not mentioned in the documents. Ritodrine, Magnesium sulphate, and Dexamethasone are all medications that can be used to treat preterm labor and decrease uterine contractility.", "answer_choice": B}
